summary: The document is an FBI memorandum from September 27, 1963, concerning the JFK assassination investigation. It outlines an inquiry into telephone numbers associated with Robert A. Mahed and Associates' Los Angeles office, aiming to identify subscribers, among whom are two former FBI Special Agents. The investigation extends to conducting background checks on several individuals in Virginia, scrutinizing their employment, residence, and possible links to gambling or racketeering. The memo underscores the confidential nature of telephone records, noting the necessity of a subpoena for their public release, and suggests further investigative leads such as employment verification and probing into gambling or racketeering connections.
key_findings: Investigation into telephone numbers linked to Robert A. Mahed and Associates' office in Los Angeles.
Identification of subscribers, including two former FBI Special Agents.
Background checks on individuals in Virginia, focusing on employment, residence, and potential illegal activities.
Confidential nature of telephone records, requiring a subpoena for public disclosure.
Leads for further investigation include verifying employment and checking for gambling or racketeering activities.
